author: stefanbratanov
content: For Teku, would be useful to track the network bandwith once there are blobs to ensure no excessive rpc calls are being made

author: parithosh
content: Is there a specific teku metric i should track?

author: stefanbratanov
content: I suppose `libp2p_gossip_messages_total` and the usual node exporter metrics for bandwith

author: parithosh
content:
Not sure who the data is explicitly useful for, but sharing nonetheless:
We currently have a "pristine" shadowfork, i.e like 100% participation and block propagation happening <250ms mostly and attestation happening on time. 

We however see these spikes periodically (fig. 1). The period basically corresponds to the length of an epoch, so its likely that we're seeing the effect of an epoch transition on the block propagation. 

You can tear this analysis down a bit more and filter per CL to see the effect the transition has on every CL. 

Teku seems to be seeing a ~1s deviation from other slots (fig. 2). 
Prysm sees no real pattern, epoch transitions don't seem to have an effect (fig. 3)
Lodestar sees a change in almost 1.5s (fig. 4)
Lighthouse sees a change in almost 1s (fig. 5)
Nimbus data is missing as we had a misconfigured xatu node, its been fixed now and we'll update later on (initial data suggests no effect)

author: parithosh
content:
raw dashboards found here, filter for CL at the top. 
https://grafana.observability.ethpandaops.io/d/MR_U64N4k/beacon-api-events?orgId=1&var-network_name=dencun-gsf-1&var-client_name=All&var-consensus_implementation=All&var-consensus_version=All&var-geo_continent_code=All&var-heatmap_interval=250&var-interval_tight=$__auto_interval_interval_tight&var-interval=$__auto_interval_interval&var-interval_loose=$__auto_interval_interval_loose&var-table_prefix=&var-attestation_prefix=

content:

- `gossipsub_topic_msg_published_total` (and `_recv_counts_`) for lighthouse
- `gossipsub_accepted_messages_total`  for lodestar
- ?? for prysm?

author: samcm
content:
It looks like nimbus doesn't support the `blob_sidecar` event yet:

```
curl "http://localhost:5052/eth/v1/events?topics=blob_sidecar" -H "accept: text/event-stream"            
                       
{"code":400,"message":"Invalid topics value","stacktraces":["Incorrect event's topic value"]}
```
